description.narrative: The present project proposal offers an approach and a methodology for addressing the PA financing challenge at local, national and regional levels.

activity-description.narrative: South Cameroon (for National PA); South-West (for the Cameroon-Equatorial Guinea cross-border PAs); South-East (for cross-border PA Cameroon - Congo - CAR); South (for the Transboundary PA Cameroon - Gabon - Congo).

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1) Financial scorecard results (outcome 1) – Output 1.1 2) System-level PA business plans (PA system-level financial sustainability strategies) - Output 1.2 3) System-level PA business plans - Output 1.3. 4) Laws, policies and regulations related to sustainable PA financing - Output 1.4. 5) Active support and participation in PA financing among public and corporate sector financial and economic decision-makers - Output 1.5. 6) Agreed procedures and formulae in place to earmark public revenues for PAs and PA-adjacent communities - Output 1.6. 7) Regional-level exchange of experience leading to uptake of lessons learned across borders - Output 1.7. 8) Financial scorecard results (outcome 2) – Output 2.1. 9) Use of revenue generating mechanisms at pilot sites - Output 2.2. 10) Trust funds working to deliver long-term financing to Pas - Output 2.3. 11) Disbursement of revenues to PA centres, PAs and PA-adjacent communities - Output 2.4. 12) In-country capacity to identify, plan for and implement new PA revenue mechanisms- Output 2.5. 13) Financial scorecard results (outcome 3) -Output 3.1. 14) Site-level human resources and infrastructural capacity for PA management planning and practice - Output 3.2. 15) Site-level capacity to integrate PA management and business planning - Output 3.3. 16) Integration of economic valuation into PA planning and policy-setting mechanisms to their voters- Output 3.4. 17) Monitoring and reporting on financial management performance - Output 3.5.

comment.narrative: 1) Baseline Output 1.1: Cameroon – 42%; CAR -27%; Congo -12%; DRC – 31%; EG – 16%; Gabon – 28%; Regional Mean – 39% 2) Baseline Output 1.2.: No financial sustainability strategies 3) Baseline Output 1.3.: No system-level PA business plans 4) Baseline Output 1.4.: PA laws contain weak or no reference to innovative (i.e. non-government, tourism and donor) sources of financing 5) Baseline Output 1.5.: PA financing carried out with little support or contribution from public and corporate sector financial and economic decision-makers 6) Baseline Output 1.6.: No central system for sharing revenues between PA sites and with center limited or no application of community-revenue sharing mechanisms at site levels 7) Baseline Output 1.7.: Structure for cooperation and exchange exists under Plan de Convergence, but actual exchange of experience is limited 8) Baseline Output 2.1.: Cameroon – 22%; CAR -17%; Congo -11%; DRC – 16% ; EG – 6%; Gabon 9) Baseline Output 2.2. : Over 75% PA funding sourced from public budgets and donor assistance PAs unable to cover management costs due to insufficient funds. 10) Baseline Output 2.3.: PAs across the region rely on annual budget-allocations or income, or on short-term donor projects 11) Baseline Output 2.4.: Negligible quantities of fiscal revenues from other sectors reallocated to Pas - No central system for sharing revenues between PA sites and with center - Limited or no application of community-revenue sharing mechanisms at site levels 12) Baseline Output 2.5.: PA staff and key stakeholders lack the skills-base and tools to identify, plan for and implement new PA revenue mechanisms 13) Baseline Output 3.1.: Cameroon – 28%; CAR -34% - Congo -6%; DRC – 25%; EG – 3%; Gabon – 20%; Regional Mean – 29% 14) Baseline Output 3.2.: PAs across the region are poorly resourced and equipped 15) Baseline Output 3.3.: PA staff at the site level lack the skills and approaches to integrate financing aspects into PA management planning PAs across the

En 2019, le projet régional prévoit accélérer la mise en œuvre des activités en progressant vers l’atteinte des 3 résultats interconnectés pour l’atteinte de l’objectif ultime dudit projet qui est de mettre en place dans les 6 pays participants (Cameroun, Congo, Gabon, Guinée Equatoriale, RCA & RDC), des mécanismes de financements durables pour la conservation de la Biodiversité dans les Aires Protégées du Bassin du Congo. Aussi au titre de l’AWP 2019, 19 résultats cibles ont été identifiés pour être réalisés dans chacun des 6 pays (Cameroun, Congo, Gabon, Guinée Equatoriale, RCA & RDC). Il s’agit de lélaboration &adoption à léchelle nationale et/ou transfrontalière (sous-regional) de : Cible 1 a & b : 1 Stratégie Nationale de Financement durable des Aires Protégées pour la Conservation de la Biodiversité (SNFDAP/CBD) & 1 Plan d’Action (Triennal) de la SNFDAP/CBD. Cible 2 : 1 Rapport technique sur les lois, Politiques et Réglementations nouvelles ou actualisées nécessaires au financement durable des aires protégées. Cible 3 : 1 Plan national de Communication et de plaidoyer pour la sensibilisation (plaidoyer) accrue auprès des Décideurs financiers et économiques, du secteur public et des entreprises pour accélérer l’appropriation Cible 4 : 1 Rapport technique sur les règlementations / engagements institutionnels relatifs aux procédures de conservation et de distribution des recettes issues de la gestion des APs nationaux. Cible 5 : 1 Rapport technique sur l’état de la collecte des données nécessaire à la préparation de la Stratégie de financement de la conservation au niveau sous-régional quinquennal axée sur les AP, les corridors et les zones tampons. Cible 6 : 1 Rapport technique sur ses aspects juridiques et réglementaires ; de politique environnementale ; de leçons apprises et des tests de réplication. Cible 7 : 1 Plan d’action pour la formation des gestionnaires d’AP et autres parties prenantes à la gestion et financement des AP (pour la conservation de la Biodiversité) ; et sur besoins en capacitation des acteurs nationaux. Cible 8 : 1 Plan d’action holistique pour la formation des formateurs et capacitations des parties prenantes, pour l’acquisition des connaissances en matière de développement des matériels de formation et la formation à la mise en œuvre des mécanismes de financements dans le travail sur le terrain. Cible 9 : 1 Plan d’action holistique pour l’Edition/ Publication/ Vulgarisation Communication, de la stratégie nationale SNFDAP et ses documents connexes/ annexes Cible 10 : 1 Rapport technique sur la Finance environnementale et déconomie & législation / politique environnementale des APs. Cible 11 : 1 Rapport technique holistique sur le profil de la finance environnementale du pays axé sur les APs. Cible 12 : 1 Plan d’Action holistique relatif aux besoins en formation / capacitations sur les outils de validation des leçons apprises et réplication, de suivi et mesure des indicateurs liés au résultat1 (du Prodoc) au niveau des systèmes d’APs nationaux (et transfrontaliers). Cible 13 : 1 Plan d’Action holistique pour la formation / capacitation des gestionnaires dAP à élaborer et piloter la mise en œuvre des mécanismes de recettes des APs et les outils pour développer et mettre en place des mécanismes dallocation (des recettes issues de la gestion des APs). Cible 14 : 1 Plan d’Action holistique à annexer à la Stratégie nationale de Communication par pays et à capitaliser sur le Site Web du Projet régional, l’élaboration de tous les outils COMM (y inclus les blogs/contenus de publication sur le site Web et media sociaux, les imprimés/ Flyers, le matériel didactique/ Manuels de formation liés à la production et au décaissement de recettes issus de la gestion des APs. Cible 15 : 1 Rapport technique sur l’évaluation des capacités des acteurs clés (gestionnaires et formateurs des formateurs… ) travaillant dans les systèmes d’APs nationaux et transfrontaliers & 1Plan d’Action holistique pour le renforcement des capacités des acteurs clés des APs sur les mécanismes de Financement / économie de lenvironnement; en finance / planification environnementale; planification des activités; en suivi, apprentissage des leçons et gestion adaptative. Cible 16 : 1 Plan d’action national sur la capitalisation des leçons apprises et la réplication aux niveaux national (et sous-régional). Cible 17 : 1 Rapport technique holistique issue de la collecte & analyse des données relatif à l’évaluation de la pertinence des outils actuels (potentiellement à améliorer) de surveillance (suivi) et la mesure des indicateurs de gestion et financements améliorés des APs au niveau national (et sous-régional). Cible 18 : 1 Rapport technique holistique assorti d’un Plan d’action, issue de la collecte & analyse des données relatives aux besoins en Formation (au niveau national & régional), sur l’apprentissage des leçons, la diffusion, l’appui à la réplication, léconomie de lenvironnement, le développement des Plans d’Affaires (Business Plan) au niveau national (et sous-régional). Cible 19 : 1 Rapport technique holistique issu de la collecte des données relatives à l’élaboration des Plans d’Affaires (existant ou non) et les outils stratégiques / pertinents pour évaluer leur pertinence par pays et à l’échelle sous-régionale & 1 Plan d’action M&E par pays (+ 1 sous-régional).

Cible/Action 1a : faire la review des données de base du Dashboard financier lié au Résultat 1 Cible/Action 1b: collecter des données additionnelles et refaire le Scorcard financier (exercice IMET) lié au Résultat 1 Cible/Action2a: finaliser les annexes manquantes à la SNFDAP+ Plan d’Action Cible/Action 2b : réaliser les actions de plaidoyers, sensibilisation et dissémination de la SNFDAP/CBD + Plan d’action en vue de l’appropriation /adoption finale par le pays. Cible/Action 2c : réaliser l’étude de faisabilité et/ou démarrer les activités de démonstration identifiées dans la SNFDAP/Plan d’action + rapport holistiques annexés, notamment dans les sites pilotes déjà identifiés et autorisés par le pays (Autorités nationales dédiées). Cible/Action3a: faire une collecte des données et analyse de la pertinence des Business plan déjà existants des sites pilotes déjà identifiés et autorisés en vue de l’amélioration (si nécessaire) ; Cible/Action 3b : réaliser une étude de faisabilité en vue de doter d’un Business Plan les APs pilotes identifiés et autorisés par le pays. Cible/Action 3c : une fois le BP disponible pour le/les site (s) pilote (s), réaliser les actions de familiarisation/formation des Gestionnaires des APs pilotes au nouveau BP ou a l’ancien BP amélioré Cible/Action4: Réaliser les actions de plaidoyers / sensibilisation à l’endroit des Décideurs politiques et Gestionnaires des APs pilotes autorisés par le pays, en vue de la pris en compte du /des mécanismes de financement durable (solution financière durable) déjà identifiés dans la SNFDAP/Plan d’Action, dans les dans les documents de politiques (institutionnelles) pays ainsi que les législations. Cible/Action5: Réaliser les actions de plaidoyers / sensibilisation à l’endroit des Décideurs politiques et plus spécifiquement les acteurs clés du pays en charges des questions financières/ économiques (Secteurs public et privé) en vue d’une contribution à l’opérationnalisation du /des mécanismes de financement durable (solution financière durable) déjà identifiés dans la SNFDAP/Plan d’Action, dans les sites pilotes autorisés. Cible/Action 6a : faire la review des données de base du Dashboard financier lié au Résultat 2 Cible/Action 6b: collecter des données additionnelles et refaire le Scorcard financier (exercice IMET) lié au Résultat 2 Cible/Action7a : réaliser des actions de plaidoyers et de sensibilisations des Décideurs / Acteurs clés nationaux en vue de la prise des décisions requises pour la finalisation de la création de l’Agence dédiée à la gestion des systèmes d’APs nationaux. Cible/Action7b: Réaliser les actions d’accompagnement requis pour contribuer à la réalisation de cette création de lAgence Camerounaise de gestion des APs/Faune. Cible/Action8a : Faire une analyse approfondie des mécanismes de partage des revenus déjà existants sur les sites pilotes désignés et proposer le cas échéant des actions additionnelles en vue de leur amélioration Cible/Action8b: Réaliser les actions requises de plaidoyers et de sensibilisations des Décideurs / Acteurs clés nationaux/ Gestionnaires des APs, en vue de l’application des textes / mécanismes existants ou innovants proposés en vue de rendre effective le partage des revenus issus de la gestion des APs. Cible/Action9 : Faire une analyse approfondie décisions (Décret/ Arrêté...), existants des mécanismes de redistribution ainsi que les procédures et formule de partage applicables à certains revenus fiscaux en faveur des sites pilotes d’APs. Faire un plaidoyer auprès des Décideurs Politiques pour leur implémentation. Cible/Action10 : Faire une mise à jour du Plan d’action relatif aux besoins en renforcement des capacités des Gestionnaires / Acteurs intervenants dans les APs et réaliser au moins deux types de formations qualifiantes identifiées dans le Plan d’Action et approuvées par les parties concernées. Cible/Action11 : Faire une mise à jour du Plan d’action relatif aux besoins en renforcement des capacités et doter les Gestionnaires / Acteurs intervenants dans les APs pilotes des Outils de formation et des produits de connaissance. Cible/Action 12a : faire la review des données de base du Dashboard financier lié au Résultat 3 Cible/Action 12b: collecter des données additionnelles et refaire le Scorcard financier (exercice IMET) lié au Résultat 3 Cible/Action13 : Faire une mise à jour du Plan d’action relatif aux besoins en renforcement des capacités et doter les Gestionnaires / Acteurs intervenants dans les APs et réaliser la formation d’au moins 50 de ces personnels des Sites d’APs Pilotes. Cible/Action14 : Produire et/ou contribuer à la préparation dun Manuel relatif à la méthodologie de planification (dans le cadre du Business Plan) des Sites Pilotes d’APs désignés. Faire la dissémination et le plaidoyer pour l’appropriation par les Gestionnaires / Acteurs intervenants dans les Sites d’APs Pilotes. Cible/Action15a : faire réaliser une étude de l’évaluation économique assortie d’une modélisation contextualisée d’au moins un Mécanisme de financement durable (solution financière durable) sur au moins 1 site pilote d’AP national ; Cible/Action15b : réaliser les actions de plaidoyers auprès des Décideurs et de Sensibilisation auprès des acteurs clés en vue de l’intégration de l’évaluation économique dans les plans et politiques relatives aux Mécanismes de financement durable (solution financière durable) des systèmes d’APs nationaux.

Results achieved in 2020 despite the constraints arising from the COVID19 pandemic.
NB: with the unexpected arrival of new environmental, safety and health risks linked to the COVID19 pandemic, a review exercise of the results / target initially planned for the year 2020 was carried out. All 6 countries, in consultation with the national side and the National Steering Committee, carried out a review by prioritizing all the targets to be reached in 2020 for the 3 components of the regional project. Thus, the situation of the results targeted and prioritized by the countries in 2020 (AWP 2020 reviewed and prioritized) is as follows:
1) For component 1 of the regional project:
Target 1a: review the basic data of the Financial Dashboard linked to Result 1: prioritized to be achieved until 2021, because this result is due to the last year of the project (year 5: 2021): ongoing for the 6 countries (Cameroon, Congo, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, CAR and DRC): around 50% already achieved in 2020
Target 1b: collect additional data and redo the Financial Scorcard (IMET exercise) linked to Result 1: prioritized to be achieved until 2021, because this result is due to the last year of the project (year 5: 2021): ongoing for the 6 countries: around 30% already achieved in 2020.
Target 2a: finalize the missing annexes to the SNFDAP + Action Plan: in progress for - countries: around 50 - 60% already completed in 2020.
Target 2b: carry out advocacy, awareness and dissemination actions of the SNFDAP / CBD + Action plan for final ownership / adoption by the country : postponed to 2021 for the 6 countries due to new constraints that appeared with the COVID19 pandemic. However, awareness tools were prepared during 2020.
Target 2c: carry out the feasibility study and / or start the demonstration activities identified in the SNFDAP / Action plan + appended holistic report, in particular in the pilot sites already identified and authorized by the country (dedicated national authorities) : for the 6 countries, approximately 50% of this target result is achieved in 2020. The rest is postponed to 2021, due to unforeseen constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic.
Target 3a: collect data and analyze the relevance of the already existing business plans of the pilot sites already identified and authorized for improvement (if necessary): for the 6 countries, this result has already been reached at around 70– 90%, in 2020.
Target 3b: carry out a feasibility study with a view to providing a Business Plan for the pilot PAs identified and authorized by the country : a draft is already available for at least 3 countries out of the 6 which are involved in the regional project. And it is expected to finalize at least 3 BP before the end of 2020.
Target 3c: once the BP is available for the pilot site (s), carry out familiarization / training actions for the Managers of the pilot PAs to the new BP or to the old improved BP: for the 6 countries, this result / target is postponed to 2021 due to (unforeseen) constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic.
Target 4: Carry out advocacy / awareness actions aimed at political decision-makers and managers of pilot PAs authorized by the country, with a view to taking into account the sustainable financing mechanism (s) (sustainable financial solution) already identified in the SNFDAP / Action Plan, in country (institutional) policy documents and legislation: for the 6 countries, this result / target is postponed to 2021 due to (unforeseen) constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic.
Target 5: Carry out advocacy / awareness actions aimed at political decision-makers and more specifically the key players in the country in charge of financial / economic issues (public and private sectors) with a view to contributing to the operationalization of / sustainable financing mechanisms (sustainable financial solution) already identified in the SNFDAP / Action Plan, in the authorized pilot sites: for the 6 countries, this result / target is postponed to 2021 due to (unforeseen) constraints related to the COVID19 pandemic. Around 10 - 15% of the prerequisites were nevertheless met in 2020.
2) For component 2 of the regional project:
Target 6a: review the basic data of the Financial Dashboard linked to Result 2: prioritized to be achieved until 2021, because this result is due to the last year of the project (year 5: 2021): ongoing for the 6 countries (Cameroon, Congo, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, CAR and DRC): around 50% already achieved in 2020.
Target 6b: collect additional data and redo the Financial Scorcard (IMET exercise) linked to Result 2: prioritized to be achieved until 2021, because this result is due to the last year of the project (year 5: 2021): ongoing for the 6 countries: around 30% already achieved in 2020.
Target 7a: carry out advocacy and sensitization actions for national decision-makers / key actors with a view to making the decisions required for the finalization of the creation of the agency dedicated to the management of national PA systems : for the 6 countries, this result / target is postponed to 2021 due to (unforeseen) constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic. Around 10 - 25% of the prerequisites were nevertheless met in 2020, especially in countries where an agency / institute dedicated to PAs does not yet exist.
Target 7b: Carry out the accompanying actions required to contribute to the realization of this creation of the PA / Wildlife Management Agency : postponed to 2021 and only for countries where it does not yet exist, because in 4 of the 6 countries, an agency / institute dedicated to PAs already exists and is operational.
Target 8a: Carry out an in-depth analysis of the revenue-sharing mechanisms already in existence at the designated pilot sites and, if necessary, propose additional actions for their improvement: for the 6 countries, this result / target is prioritized to be achieved in 2020, despite the constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic: around 60 - 80% already achieved and for 3 of the 6 countries, it has already been finalized.
Target 8b: Carry out the required actions of advocacy and sensitization of decision-makers / key national actors / PA managers, with a view to the application of existing or innovative texts / mechanisms proposed in order to make effective the sharing of income from management of APs. : for the 6 countries, this result / target is postponed to 2021 due to (unforeseen) constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic. Around 10 - 25% of the prerequisites were nevertheless met in 2020 (awareness tools, advocacy, etc.).
Target 9: Carry out an in-depth analysis of existing decisions (Decree / Decree, etc.) of redistribution mechanisms as well as the procedures and sharing formula applicable to certain tax revenues in favor of PA pilot sites. Advocate with Policy Makers for their implementation : for the 6 countries, this result / target is prioritized to be achieved in 2020, despite the constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic: around 60 - 80% already achieved and for 3 of the 6 countries, it has already been finalized.
Target 10: Update the Action Plan relating to the capacity building needs of Managers / Actors involved in PAs and carry out at least two types of qualifying training identified in the Action Plan and approved by the parties concerned : for the 6 countries, around 50% of the prerequisites have already been completed, an update of the training / capacity building needs already available for finalization and the start of training in 2021 (constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic).
Target 11: Update the Action Plan relating to capacity building needs and provide Managers / Actors involved in pilot PAs with training tools and knowledge products : for the 6 countries, around 50% of the prerequisites have already been completed, an update of the training / training needs already available for finalization of a Guide & training tools
3) For component 2 of the regional project:
NB: most of the activities planned in this component have been revised to contribute to the global response to the consequences of the COVID19 pandemic, in particular from 2021. Only the essential target results attached to the other two components of the regional project have been addressed in the AWP 2020 review.
Target 12a: review the basic data of the Financial Dashboard linked to Result 3: prioritized to be achieved until 2021, because this result is due to the last year of the project (year 5: 2021): ongoing for the 6 countries (Cameroon, Congo, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, CAR and DRC) - around 50% already achieved in 2020.
Target 12b: collect additional data and redo the Financial Scorcard (IMET exercise) linked to Result 3: prioritized to be achieved until 2021, because this result is due to the last year of the project (year 5: 2021): ongoing for the 6 countries: around 30% already achieved in 2020.
Target 13: Update the Action Plan relating to capacity building needs and provide Managers / Actors involved in PAs and train at least 50 of these staff from Pilot PA sites: for the 6 countries, this result / target is postponed to 2021 due to (unforeseen) constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic. Around 10 - 25% of the prerequisites were nevertheless met in 2020.
Target 14: Produce and / or contribute to the preparation of a Manual relating to the planning methodology (within the framework of the Business Plan) of designated PA Pilot Sites. Disseminate and advocate for ownership by Managers / Actors involved in Pilot PA Sites : 3 countries out of 6 already have a draft Guide (Manual for trainers of trainers on key themes taking into account the holistic report relating to capacity building needs) and 1 country has already fully finalized and awaiting technical validation. The start of training has been postponed to 2021 (constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic).
Target 14: Produce and / or contribute to the preparation of a Manual relating to the planning methodology (within the framework of the Business Plan) of designated PA Pilot Sites. Disseminate and advocate for ownership by Managers / Actors involved in Pilot PA Sites : 3 countries out of 6 already have a draft Guide (Manual for trainers of trainers on key themes taking into account the holistic report relating to capacity building needs) and 1 country has already fully finalized and awaiting technical validation. The start of training has been postponed to 2021 (constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic).
Target 15a: Have an economic appraisal study carried out accompanied by contextualized modeling of at least one Sustainable Financing Mechanism (sustainable financial solution) on at least 1 national PA pilot site: for the 6 countries and despite unforeseen constraints linked to the COVID19 pandemic, approximately 50 to 70% of this result has already been achieved, to date. It is planned to finalize at least this assessment for at least 4/6 countries participating in the regional project.
Target 15b: carry out advocacy actions with decision-makers and sensitization with key actors with a view to integrating economic evaluation into plans and policies relating to sustainable financing mechanisms (sustainable financial solution) of PA systems national: for the 6 countries, postponed to 2021, due to new unforeseen constraints associated with the COVID19 pandemic.
Other results achieved / other achievements of the regional project in 2020:
1) In terms of knowledge management and multi-faceted capacity building: 12 knowledge management / technical capacity building workshops for country teams (regional project staff to improve their service delivery) were organized online (ZOOM) despite the crisis linked to the COVID19 pandemic . The following 12 themes were the subject of these exchange and capacity building workshops: at. a. Theme 1: Engage / invest in biodiversity b. b. Theme 2: Importance of the land use planning (LUP) in the sustainable management and financing of PAs: the case of TRIDOM / Interzone Ngoyla-Mintom vs. c. Theme 3: Importance of participatory mapping for the involvement and taking into account of the rights of indigenous peoples and local communities in the management of protected areas: case of the Mbaéré Bodingué National Park in the Central African Republic d. d. Theme 4: Mechanisms for sharing the benefits from biodiversity (case of Gabon) e. Theme 5: The complaint and conflict management mechanism in protected areas (case of the DRC). e. Theme 6: The approach to institutional management of protected areas: opportunities and challenges, the case of Gabon. f. Theme 7: Economic and legal instruments for sustainable financing of biodiversity. g. Theme 8: Importance and issue of Payments for Environmental Services (PES) in favor of PAs and PA self-financing: Case of Nouabalé-Ndoki-Congo National Park. h. Theme 9: Sustainable tourisms in rural areas as an opportunity for developing small communities from developing countries in Equatorial Guinea i. Theme 10: Involvement of forest-dependent communities in conservation: the case of BAKA & BANTU - An integrated participatory approach to biodiversity management around the Dja Biosphere Reserve (Cameroon). j. Theme 11: Development of a Trust Fund for Conservation: Case of the Okapi Fund for Nature Conservation in the DRC (FOCON). k. Theme 12: The implementation of the CBD in Cameroon
2) In terms of communication: communication tools have been acquired and available for advocacy and capacity building actions for stakeholders (Key players in the conservation of biodiversity in PAs: PA managers, local communities and Indigenous populations, conservation actors in PAs, etc.). Both at the regional level (UGCP based here in Yaoundé and at the national level (of 6 countries), communications on and for the achievement of the results of the regional project have been made.
3) The project has also contributed significantly to the development of the new CO / CMR CPD 2021 - 2025. 4) The project also contributed to building the technical capacities of country office staff, particularly with regard to the technical teams attached to the unit in charge of Sustainable Development and Climate Resilience ...
5) Other results achieved / activities carried out in 2020: 1) the 2020 PIR (on the GEF PIMS platform) and which covers the period from July 1, 2019 to June 30, 2020, had a rating of MS (Moderately Satisfactory) despite the arrival of the unforeseen crisis linked to the COVD19 pandemic; (2) for the 3rd consecutive year, the NIM / NEX External Audit received a rating of Satisfactory , which is proof of excellent operationalization (financial monitoring, results-based delivery, etc.) of this regional project.

1) For Result / Component 1: focus on finalizing the target results provided for in year 5 of the start of the project and complete with all the other targeted results of this same component 1 which were reprioritized in 2021 due to of the unforeseen global health crisis due to the COVID19 pandemic. If traffic conditions and other multifaceted constraints related to COVID19 allow, start demonstration activities on pilot PA sites. 2) For Result 2/Component 2: focus on 4/5 targets out of 10 potentially due and / or attainable in year 4 and year 5 of the implementation of the regional project: support for the finalization of tools (generation mechanisms e sharing of resources from PAs / and related legislation; Tools for improving resource management in PAs; training of PA managers on optimal PA management tools; implementation in pilot PA sites for management tools, generation, redistribution etc ...) / Complete with activities targeted in 2020 but which were reprioritized in 2021 due to the un-foreseen crisis linked to COVID19. 3) For Result 3/ component 3: focus on 4/5 targets out of the 7 potentially due and / or attaina-ble in year 4 and year 5 of the implementation of the regional project: training of trainers / man-agers of PAs on pilot sites; economic assessment / contextualized modeling of sustainable fi-nancing mechanisms. Add to this the activities related to the Call for Expressions of Interest / Call for Proposals in order to strengthen the capacities and resilience of local communities / indige-nous populations of pilot AP sites by reducing their vulnerability due to the crisis related to the COVID19 pandemic while improving their contribution to Biodiversity conservation efforts / sustainable management of natural resources in and around these pilot sites of APs, in the 6 countries. The implementation of this Call for Proposals (Call for expression of interests – CEI) will have to answer the question of Social and environmental sustainability that the Regional Project aims to achieve by the end of the project, in particular, through its component 3 (cf. Result 3 / Prodoc).

The situation of the results targeted/prioritized and achieved by the six (6) participating countries (Cameroon, Congo, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, CAR & DRC) in the regional project during the year 2021 is as follows:
1) For component 1 of the regional project: Result/Target 1a: review of the basic data of the Financial Dashboard linked to Result 1: the six participating countries have a Financial Dashboard document linked to Result 1, 100% achieved Result/Target 1b: the collection of additional data and redoing the financial scorecard (IMET exercise) linked to Result 1: these additional data for the financial scorecard linked to result 1 were all collected in the six participating countries that made it possible to carry out the target 1a, 100% achieved Result/Target 2a: the missing annexes to the SNFDAP+ Action Plan: all six countries have completed the missing annexes to the SNFDAP, 100% achieved Result/Target 2b: Advocacy, awareness-raising and dissemination actions of the SNFDAP/CBD + Action plan for the appropriation/final adoption by the country: 100% achieved Result/Target 2c: the feasibility study and/or start the demonstration activities identified in the SNFDAP/Action Plan + annexed holistic reports, in the pilot sites already identified and authorized by the country (dedicated national authorities): 100% Result / Target 3a: the finalization of the additional annexes to the Business plan already drawn up (2020) for the pilot sites, to have them edited and disseminated for use by the Key Players in the management of the pilot PAs, for the six (6) countries: the 12 sites pilots have a business plan and the edition is to be scheduled during the year 2022. Result/Target 3b: once the BP of the pilot site(s) has been published, the dissemination actions (advocacy with decision-makers, familiarization/training of key conservation actors, managers of pilot PAs, etc.): carried out at 70% (in countries where the context linked to the COVID19 pandemic has allowed it). Result /Target 4: Advocacy / awareness actions towards political decision-makers, key conservation actors, managers of pilot PAs (designated by the country), with a view to taking into account the prerequisites favorable to the implementation put in place sustainable financing mechanisms (sustainable financial solutions) including, among others, those identified in the SNFDAP/Action Plan and/or in policy documents (institutional/legislative): 80% (actions carried out in 5/6 countries except the DRC for a critical reason of the covid-19 pandemic which did not allow the organization of workshops). Result /Target 5: Advocacy / awareness actions aimed at political decision-makers and more specifically key actors in the country, key actors / TFPs in conservation and in charge of financial / economic issues (public and private sectors) in view a contribution to the implementation of the prerequisites required for the implementation of a sustainable financing mechanism (sustainable financial solution) already identified in the SNFDAP/CBD + Action Plan, at least on a pilot basis in the sites of PAs designated: 80% (actions carried out in 5/6 countries except the DRC for a critical reason of the covid-19 pandemic which did not allow the organization of workshops).
2) For component 2 of the regional project: Result / Target 6a: Review of the basic data of the Financial Dashboard linked to Result 2: the six participating countries have a Financial Dashboard document linked to Result 2, 100% achieved Result/Target 6b: Collection of additional data and redoing of the financial scorecard (IMET exercise) linked to Result 2: these additional data for the financial scorecard linked to result 2 were all collected in the six participating countries that made it possible to carry out the target 1a, 100% achieved Result / Target 7a: Advocacy and awareness-raising actions towards political decision-makers and key actors (including TFPs) involved in the Conservation / sustainable management of national PAs with a view to taking the decisions required to progress towards the creation of an Agency dedicated to national PA systems: 50% (actions have been undertaken for Cameroon with a draft text submitted at the level of parliamentarians and the CAR through talks with decision-makers from the ministry in charge of forests / Presidential decree of creation in progress). Result/Target 7b: the accompanying actions required to contribute to the realization of this creation (where this does not yet exist: CAR and Cameroon) and where they exist, contribute as far as possible to their efforts (activities decisive keys) to improve the conservation and/or optimal sustainable management of PAs: 90% (actions carried out to support the creation of agencies in CAR and Cameroon and equipment allocations for agencies in Gabon and capacity building in Equatorial Guinea and Congo and DRC). Target 8a: the report stating the revenue sharing mechanisms already available (2020) for the designated pilot sites and carrying out advocacy / information / training actions with a view to its appropriation and operationalization in the pilot PA sites of each of the 6 countries: 90% (actions carried out in 5/6 countries except the DRC (no report available due to the unsuccessful process of recruiting an IC). Result/Target 8b: the actions required for the Training of Trainers, Key Conservation Actors (including TFPs), PA Managers, Local Communities of the two pilot PA sites… for the use and application at the scale of said sites/residential populations: 90% achieved Result/Target 9: the report showing an in-depth analysis of existing (and/or innovative) legislative texts and decisions (Decree/Order), redistribution mechanisms and sharing formulas applicable to certain tax revenues in favor of PA pilot sites in each of the – countries and use this report to advocate/information with Policy-makers and key Conservation/Finance actors (including TFPs) for their operationalization on a pilot basis in the PA sites designated in each of the six (6) countries: 90% (actions carried out in 5/6 countries except the DRC because report unavailable due to unsuccessful recruitment process of an IC). Result / Target 10: an update of the Report / Action Plan relating to the capacity building needs of Key Actors / Managers / Actors intervening in PAs and carry out at least two types of qualifying training identified in the statement of needs developed in a participatory manner: 100%. Result /Target 11: an update of the Action Plan relating to capacity building needs and use of the training modules available to equip the Key PA/Conservation Actors (PA Managers / Actors intervening in and around the PAs / Representatives pilot communities) of tools, knowledge products and technical capacities necessary for optimal PA management (particularly regarding the pilot PAs designated in each of the 6 countries): 100%
3) For component 3 of the regional project: Result / Target 12a: review of the basic data of the Financial Dashboard linked to Result 3: the six participating countries have a Financial Dashboard document linked to Result 3, 100% achieved Result/Target 12b: Collection of additional data and redoing of the financial scorecard (IMET exercise) linked to Result 3: these additional data for the financial scorecard linked to result 3 were all collected in the six participating countries that made it possible to carry out the target 1a, 100% achieved Result /Target 13: an update of the Action Plan relating to capacity building needs and use the existing modules to equip the Key Actors (Managers / Intervening Actors, TFPs, Local Community Representatives, etc.) with national APs (designated at pilot title) to carry out the training of at least 50 of these personnel on the approaches to integrate the financial aspects in the planning / realization of coherent financial or commercial plans for an optimal management of the PAs (priority sites of Pilot PAs): 100 % Result / Target 14: Dissemination and use of the Manual (Methodological Guide) developed / published, in each of the 6 countries Produce and / or contribute to the capacity building of Key Actors / Managers of PAs, Trainers of trainers. Advocate for ownership by decision-makers and key actors (Managers / PA stakeholders (Pilot sites) for maximum use to optimize the sustainable management of PAs and the conservation of biodiversity and associated ecosystems in these pilot sites: 100% Result/Target 15a: finalization of the national report on a study of the economic valuation of PA values (national pilot PA focus), contextualized by country with a view to potential use for the establishment of at least one Sustainable financing mechanism (sustainable financial solution) modeled by country (starting with designated PA pilot sites at the national level): 90% (actions carried out in 5/6 countries except the DRC because report unavailable due to process recruitment of an unsuccessful IC). Result /Target 15b: Advocacy actions with Decision-makers and Awareness raising with key actors with a view to integrating economic evaluation into plans and policies relating to Sustainable Financing Mechanisms (sustainable financial solution) of systems National PAs: 100% Result /Target 16a: efforts to conserve Biodiversity / sustainable management of natural resources in pilot sites of Protected Areas by strengthening community resilience (components 1 & 2/AMI): actions carried out at 70% and for the remaining 30% will be carried out in the first quarter of 2022 due to the delay in the release of resources (1st and 2nd payment installments). Result / Target 16b: the rapid recovery of local communities and indigenous populations made vulnerable by the crisis linked to the COVID19 pandemic, through the creation of sustainable livelihoods in order to improve their efforts for the conservation of Biodiversity in the sites of pilot PAs (component 3/AMI): actions carried out at 70% and for the remaining 30% will be carried out in the first quarter of 2022 due to the delay in the release of resources (1st and 2nd payment installments). Result/Target 16c: support and guidance for local communities/indigenous populations of pilot PA sites in the 6 countries, in particular through the creation of alternative activities (to those that put pressure on the environment and sustainable management of natural resources and those of biodiversity) Protection of the Environment & Forests (component 4/AMI): actions carried out at 70% and for the remaining 30% will be carried out during the first quarter of 2022 due to the delay in release resources (1st and 2nd payment installments).
Other results obtained / other achievements of the regional project in 2021:
1) In terms of knowledge management and multifaceted capacity building: 10 knowledge management / technical capacity building workshops for country teams (regional project staff to improve their service delivery) were held online (ZOOM) despite the crisis linked to the COVID19 pandemic. The following 10 themes were the subject of these exchange and capacity building workshops: Theme 1: Total Economic Value (TEV) of Protected Areas: How to assess it in an optimal way to use it to convince political decision-makers and TFPs to sustainably finance the national PA system (CAMEROON team) Theme 2: A SUCCESSFUL example of involvement of a community group in the process of conservation, sustainable management of biodiversity and IMPLEMENTATION of income-generating activities (Gabon team) Theme 3: Methodological guide for the development of Business Plans for a protected area (DRC team) Theme 4: Existing Distribution Mechanisms in the Scientific Reserve PAs of the Gran Caldera de Luba and the Altos de Nsork National Park (Equatorial Guinea team) Theme 5: Mechanisms for revenue sharing and biodiversity management at the scale of the 2 pilot sites: Lésio-Louna Gorilla Nature Reserve and the Léfini Faunal Reserve (Congo team) Theme 6: 2020 Financial Sustainability Dashboard: For the National System of Protected Areas (Team Cameroon) Theme 7: Analysis of benefit sharing mechanisms for the management of protected areas (RCA team) Theme 8: Transformation of the ANPN: Towards a new mode of governance of national parks (Gabon team) Theme 9: Training of PA key actors and stakeholders on production techniques and activity planning in the PAs of the Gran Caldera de Luba Scientific Reserve and the Altos de Nsork National Park (Equatorial Guinea team) Theme 10: Process of inclusion of PA sustainable financing mechanisms in Congolese legislation: Case of the revision of the law on wildlife and protected areas of the Republic of Congo (Congo team).
2) In terms of communication: communication tools have been acquired and made available for advocacy and capacity building of stakeholders (Key actors in biodiversity conservation in PAs: PA managers, local communities and indigenous populations, conservation actors in PAs, etc. Both at the regional level (UGCP based here in Yaoundé and at the national level (of 6 countries), communications on and for the achievement of the results of the regional project have been made. 3) The project also contributed significantly to the development of the new CO/RMC CPD 2022-2025 4) The project also contributed to building the technical capacities of country office staff, in particular through the active participation of country technical teams attached to the unit in charge of the environment, sustainable development and climate resilience. 5) Other results achieved / activities carried out in 2021: 1) the PIR 2021 (on the GEF PIMS platform) and which covers the period from July 1, 2020, to June 30, 2021, obtained the grade S (satisfactory) despite the arrival of the unforeseen crisis linked to the COVD19 pandemic.

1) Finalize the editing and distribution of all tools / documents produced for all six (6) countries. 2) Finalize activities to monitor the implementation of demonstration activities (cf. Component 3 of the Prodoc), (carried out thanks to the provision of Low Value Grants – LVG - to local NGOs/CBOs, on the 12 sites pilot Protected Areas distributed in the six (6) countries participating in the regional project CBSP – PIMS3447 (i.e., 2 per country: Cameroon, Congo, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, CAR & DRC) 3) Follow up with the terminal evaluation team and once the Final Report of the TE is available, dispatch to all stakeholders (country governments, EP, UNDP, GEF and other TFPs that contributed to the implementation of regional project during these 5 years of implementation). 4) Organize the last Regional Steering Committee to present the Exit Strategies as well as the proposals aimed at the sustainability of the projects achievements in the six (6) participating countries (Cameroon, Congo, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, CAR & DRC) to to advocate with the Governments of the six (6) countries as well as all the other stakeholders with a view to the follow-up to be given. 5) Monitor the operationalization of all the Assets acquired during the five years of the implementation of the regional CBSP – PIMS3447 project. 6) Finalize all other remaining activities (including operational and financial closure), of the regional project in Atlas, considering the deadlines.
